germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

segment.description: The segment for this alignment. One of V, D, J or C.

support.description: Alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.

allele_description_id.description: Unique identifier of this AlleleDescription within the file. Typically, generated by the  repository hosting the record.

allele_description_ref.description: Unique reference to the allele description, in standardized form (Repo:Label:Version)

allele_similarity_cluster_designation.description: ID of the similarity cluster used in this germline set, if designated

allele_similarity_cluster_member_id.description: Membership ID of the allele within the similarity cluster, if a cluster is designated

chromosome.description: chromosome on which the gene is located

coding_sequence.description: Nucleotide sequence of the core coding region, such as the coding region of a D-, J- or C- gene  or the coding region of a V-gene excluding the leader.

curational_tags.description: Controlled-vocabulary tags applied to this description

d_rs_3_prime_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 3 prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

d_rs_3_prime_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 3 prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

d_rs_5_prime_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of 5 the prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

d_rs_5_prime_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 5 prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

functional.description: True if the gene is functional, false if it is a pseudogene

gene_designation.description: Gene number or other identifier, as (and if) defined

gene_end.description: Co-ordinate in the sequence field of the last gene-coding nucleotide in the coding_sequence field.

gene_start.description: Co-ordinate in the sequence field of the first nucleotide in the coding_sequence field.

inference_type.description: Type of inference(s) from which this gene sequence was inferred

j_cdr3_end.description: In the case of a J-gene, the co-ordinate in the sequence field of the first nucelotide of the  conserved PHE or TRP (IMGT codon position 118).

j_codon_frame.description: Codon position of the first nucleotide in the 'coding_sequence' field. Mandatory for J genes.  Not used for V or D genes. '1' means the sequence is in-frame, '2' means that the first bp is  missing from the first codon, and '3' means that the first 2 bp are missing.

j_donor_splice.description: Co-ordinate in the sequence field of the final 3' nucleotide of the J-REGION (J-genes only).

j_rs_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of J recombination site (J-genes only).

j_rs_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of J recombination site (J-genes only).

leader_1_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART1 (V-genes only).

leader_1_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART1 (V-genes only).

leader_2_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART2 (V-genes only).

leader_2_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART2 (V-genes only).

release_description.description: Brief descriptive notes of the reason for this release and the changes embodied

species_subgroup.description: Race, strain or other species subgroup to which this subject belongs

status.description: Status of record, assumed active if the field is not present

subgroup_designation.description: Identifier of the gene subgroup or clade, as (and if) defined

utr_5_prime_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 5 prime UTR (V-genes only).

utr_5_prime_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 5 prime UTR (V-genes only).

v_rs_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of the V recombination site (V-genes only).

v_rs_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the V recombination site (V-genes only).

complete_sequences.description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value.

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing

library_generation_kit_version.description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number

library_generation_protocol.description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing

pcr_target.description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead.

physical_linkage.description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv).

physical_linkage.description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv).

complete_vdj.description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment.

receptor_variable_domain_1_aa.description: Complete amino acid sequence of the mature variable domain of the Ig heavy, TCR beta or TCR delta chain. The mature variable domain is defined as encompassing all AA from and including first AA after the the signal peptide to and including the last AA that is completely encoded by the J gene.

receptor_variable_domain_2_aa.description: Complete amino acid sequence of the mature variable domain of the Ig light, TCR alpha or TCR gamma chain. cell_species.description: Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to `species`, in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema.

cell_storage.description: TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing

complete_sequences.description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value.

library_generation_kit_version.description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number

library_generation_protocol.description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing

pcr_target.description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead.

physical_linkage.description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv).

"contains_schema" keywords indicate that the study contains data objects from the AIRR Schema of that type (Rearrangement, Clone, Cell, Receptor) while the other keywords indicate that the study design considers the type of data indicated (e.g. it is possible to have a study that "contains_paired_chain" but does not "contains_schema_cell").

study_contact.description: Full contact information of the contact persons for this study This should include an e-mail address and a persistent identifier such as an ORCID ID.

study_id.description: Unique ID assigned by study registry such as one of the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) repositories.

submitted_by.description: Full contact information of the data depositor, i.e., the person submitting the data to a repository. This should include an e-mail address and a persistent identifier such as an ORCID ID. This is supposed to be a short-lived and technical role until the submission is relased.

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing

exclusion_criteria.description: Participants are excluded from an investigation if they meet this criteria

inclusion_criteria.description: Participants in an investigation must meet this criteria

investigation.description: An investigation in which the study arm participates

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing

age_event.description: Event in the study schedule to which `Age` refers. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be `sampling`. For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between `Age event` and `Sample collection time`, hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity.

age_max.description: Upper boundary of age range or equal to age_min for specific age. This field should only be null if age_min is null.

age_min.description: Specific age or lower boundary of age range.

ethnicity.description: Ethnic group of subject (defined as cultural/language-based membership)

link_type.description: Relation between subject and `linked_subjects`, can be genetic or environmental (e.g.exposure)

linked_subjects.description: Subject ID to which `Relation type` refers

race.description: Racial group of subject (as defined by NIH)

strain_name.description: Non-human designation of the strain or breed of animal used

subject_id.description: Subject ID assigned by submitter, unique within study. If possible, a persistent subject ID linked to an INSDC or similar repository study should be used.

synthetic.description: TRUE for libraries in which the diversity has been synthetically generated (e.g. phage display)

mhc_genotype_set.description: MHC genotype set for this subject.

receptor_genotype_set.description: Immune receptor genotype set for this subject.

specimen_processing.description: A series of zero or more specimen processing steps that precede an assay

target_entity_type.description: The type of the entity being measured

time_point_label.description: Informative label for the time point

newick.description: Newick string of the tree edges.

nodes.description: Dictionary of nodes in the tree, keyed by sequence_id string

allele_name.description: Allele name as allocated by the inference pipeline

phasing.description: Chromosomal phasing indicator. Alleles with the same value are inferred to be located on the  same chromosome.

gff_end.description: Genomic co-ordinates of the end of the sequence of interest described in this record in  Ensemble GFF version 3.

gff_seqid.description: Sequence (from the assembly) of a window including the gene and preferably also the promoter region.

gff_start.description: Genomic co-ordinates of the start of the sequence of interest described in this record in  Ensemble GFF version 3.

patch_no.description: Genome assembly patch number in which this gene was determined

repository_ref.description: Queryable id or accession number of the sequence published by the repository

V1p4germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4segment.description: The segment for this alignment. One of V, D, J or C.

V1p4support.description: Alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p4allele_description_id.description: Unique identifier of this AlleleDescription within the file. Typically, generated by the  repository hosting the record.

V1p4allele_description_ref.description: Unique reference to the allele description, in standardized form (Repo:Label:Version)

V1p4allele_similarity_cluster_designatio.description: ID of the similarity cluster used in this germline set, if designated

V1p4allele_similarity_cluster_member_id.description: Membership ID of the allele within the similarity cluster, if a cluster is designated

V1p4chromosome.description: chromosome on which the gene is located

V1p4coding_sequence.description: Nucleotide sequence of the core coding region, such as the coding region of a D-, J- or C- gene  or the coding region of a V-gene excluding the leader.

V1p4curational_tags.description: Controlled-vocabulary tags applied to this description

V1p4d_rs_3_prime_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 3 prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

V1p4d_rs_3_prime_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 3 prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

V1p4d_rs_5_prime_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of 5 the prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

V1p4d_rs_5_prime_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 5 prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

V1p4functional.description: True if the gene is functional, false if it is a pseudogene

V1p4gene_designation.description: Gene number or other identifier, as (and if) defined

V1p4gene_end.description: Co-ordinate in the sequence field of the last gene-coding nucleotide in the coding_sequence field.

V1p4gene_start.description: Co-ordinate in the sequence field of the first nucleotide in the coding_sequence field.

V1p4inference_type.description: Type of inference(s) from which this gene sequence was inferred

V1p4j_cdr3_end.description: In the case of a J-gene, the co-ordinate in the sequence field of the first nucelotide of the  conserved PHE or TRP (IMGT codon position 118).

V1p4j_codon_frame.description: Codon position of the first nucleotide in the 'coding_sequence' field. Mandatory for J genes.  Not used for V or D genes. '1' means the sequence is in-frame, '2' means that the first bp is  missing from the first codon, and '3' means that the first 2 bp are missing.

V1p4j_donor_splice.description: Co-ordinate in the sequence field of the final 3' nucleotide of the J-REGION (J-genes only).

V1p4j_rs_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of J recombination site (J-genes only).

V1p4j_rs_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of J recombination site (J-genes only).

V1p4leader_1_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART1 (V-genes only).

V1p4leader_1_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART1 (V-genes only).

V1p4leader_2_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART2 (V-genes only).

V1p4leader_2_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART2 (V-genes only).

V1p4release_description.description: Brief descriptive notes of the reason for this release and the changes embodied

V1p4species_subgroup.description: Race, strain or other species subgroup to which this subject belongs

V1p4status.description: Status of record, assumed active if the field is not present

V1p4subgroup_designation.description: Identifier of the gene subgroup or clade, as (and if) defined

V1p4utr_5_prime_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 5 prime UTR (V-genes only).

V1p4utr_5_prime_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 5 prime UTR (V-genes only).

V1p4v_rs_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of the V recombination site (V-genes only).

V1p4v_rs_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the V recombination site (V-genes only).

V1p4cell_label.description: Free text cell type annotation. Primarily used for annotating cell types that are not  provided in the Cell Ontology.

V1p4cell_phenotype.description: List of cellular markers and their expression levels used to isolate the cell population.

V1p4receptors.description: Array of receptor identifiers defined for the Receptor objects associated with this cell

V1p4virtual_pairing.description: boolean to indicate if pairing was inferred.

V1p4cell_isolation.description: Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells

V1p4cell_label.description: Free text cell type annotation. Primarily used for annotating cell types that are not  provided in the Cell Ontology.

V1p4cell_number.description: Total number of cells that went into the experiment

V1p4cell_phenotype.description: List of cellular markers and their expression levels used to isolate the cell population.

V1p4cell_processing_protocol.description: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript.

V1p4cell_quality.description: Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing

V1p4cell_species.description: Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to `species`, in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema.

V1p4cell_storage.description: TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing

V1p4cells_per_reaction.description: Number of cells for each biological replicate

V1p4single_cell.description: TRUE if single cells were isolated into separate compartments

V1p4tissue_processing.description: Enzymatic digestion and/or physical methods used to isolate cells from sample

V1p4clone_count.description: Absolute count of the size (number of members) of this clone in the repertoire. This could simply be the number of sequences (Rearrangement records) observed in this clone, the number of distinct cell barcodes (unique cell_id values), or a more sophisticated calculation appropriate to the experimental protocol. Absolute count is provided versus a frequency so that downstream analysis tools can perform their own normalization.

V1p4j_alignment_end.description: End position of the J gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p4j_alignment_start.description: Start position of the J gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p4junction_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the junction.

V1p4junction_end.description: Junction region end position in the alignment (1-based closed interval).

V1p4junction_start.description: Junction region start position in the alignment (1-based closed interval).

V1p4seed_id.description: sequence_id of the seed sequence. Empty string (or null) if there is no seed sequence.

V1p4sequences.description: List sequence_id strings that act as keys to the Rearrangement records for members of the clone.

V1p4affiliation.description: ROR of the contributor's primary affiliation. Note that ROR are only minted for institutions, not from individuals institutes, divisions or departments.

V1p4affiliation_department.description: Additional information regarding the contributor's primary affiliation. Can be used to specify individual institutes, divisions or departments.

V1p4contributions.description: List of all roles the contributor had in a project

V1p4contributor_id.description: Unique identifier of this contributor within the file

V1p4orcid_id.description: ORCID identifier of the contributor. Note that if present, the label of the ORCID record should take precedence over the name reported in the `name` property.

V1p4degree.description: Optional specification of the degree of contribution, should be used if multiple individuals serve the same role.

V1p4analysis_provenance_id.description: Identifier for machine-readable PROV model of analysis provenance

V1p4collapsing_method.description: The method used for combining multiple sequences from (4) into a single sequence in (5)

V1p4data_processing_files.description: Array of file names for data produced by this data processing.

V1p4data_processing_protocols.description: General description of how QC is performed

V1p4germline_database.description: Source of germline V(D)J genes with version number or date accessed.

V1p4paired_reads_assembly.description: How paired end reads were assembled into a single receptor sequence

V1p4primary_annotation.description: If true, indicates this is the primary or default data processing for the repertoire and its rearrangements. If false, indicates this is a secondary or additional data processing.

V1p4primer_match_cutoffs.description: How primers were identified in the sequences, were they removed/masked/etc?

V1p4quality_thresholds.description: How/if sequences were removed from (4) based on base quality scores

V1p4software_versions.description: Version number and / or date, include company pipelines

V1p4phasing.description: Chromosomal phasing indicator. Alleles with the same value are inferred to be located on the  same chromosome.

V1p4disease_length.description: Time duration between initial diagnosis and current intervention

V1p4disease_stage.description: Stage of disease at current intervention

V1p4immunogen.description: Antigen, vaccine or drug applied to subject at this intervention

V1p4medical_history.description: Medical history of subject that is relevant to assess the course of disease and/or treatment

V1p4prior_therapies.description: List of all relevant previous therapies applied to subject for treatment of `Diagnosis`

V1p4study_group_description.description: Designation of study arm to which the subject is assigned to

V1p4phasing.description: Chromosomal phasing indicator. Alleles with the same value are inferred to be located on the  same chromosome.

V1p4expression_id.description: Identifier for the Expression object. This identifier must be unique within  a given study, but it is recommended that it be a universally unique record locator to enable database applications.

V1p4property.description: Name of the property observed, typically a gene or antibody identifier (and label) from a  canonical resource such as Ensembl (e.g. ENSG00000275747, IGHV3-79) or  Antibody Registry (ABREG:1236456, Purified anti-mouse/rat/human CD27 antibody).

V1p4property_type.description: Keyword describing the property type and detection method used to measure the property value. The following keywords are recommended, but custom property types are also valid: "mrna_expression_by_read_count", "protein_expression_by_fluorescence_intensity", "antigen_bait_binding_by_fluorescence_intensity", "protein_expression_by_dna_barcode_count" and "antigen_bait_binding_by_dna_barcode_count".

V1p4deleted_genes.description: Array of genes identified as being deleted in this genotype

V1p4documented_alleles.description: List of alleles documented in reference set(s)

V1p4inference_process.description: Information on how the genotype was acquired. Controlled vocabulary.

V1p4receptor_genotype_id.description: A unique identifier within the file for this Receptor Genotype, typically generated by the  repository hosting the schema, for example from the underlying ID of the database record.

V1p4undocumented_alleles.description: List of alleles inferred to be present and not documented in an identified GermlineSet

V1p4genotype_class_list.description: List of Genotypes included in this Receptor Genotype Set.

V1p4receptor_genotype_set_id.description: A unique identifier for this Receptor Genotype Set, typically generated by the repository  hosting the schema, for example from the underlying ID of the database record.

V1p4allele_descriptions.description: list of allele_descriptions in the germline set

V1p4germline_set_id.description: Unique identifier of the GermlineSet within this file. Typically, generated by the  repository hosting the record.

V1p4germline_set_name.description: descriptive name of this germline set

V1p4release_description.description: Brief descriptive notes of the reason for this release and the changes embodied

V1p4species_subgroup.description: Race, strain or other species subgroup to which this subject belongs

V1p4gene.description: The MHC gene to which the described allele belongs

V1p4reference_set_ref.description: Repository and list from which it was taken (issuer/name/version)

V1p4mhc_alleles.description: List of MHC alleles of the indicated mhc_class identified in an individual

V1p4mhc_genotype_id.description: A unique identifier for this MHCGenotype, assumed to be unique in the context of the study

V1p4mhc_genotyping_method.description: Information on how the genotype was determined. The content of this field should come from a list of recommended terms provided in the AIRR Schema documentation.

V1p4mhc_genotype_list.description: List of MHCGenotypes included in this set

V1p4mhc_genotype_set_id.description: A unique identifier for this MHCGenotypeSet

V1p4junction_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the junction.

V1p4complete_sequences.description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value.

V1p4library_generation_kit_version.description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number

V1p4library_generation_protocol.description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing

V1p4pcr_target.description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead.

V1p4physical_linkage.description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv).

V1p4template_amount.description: Amount of template that went into the process

V1p4template_class.description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures

V1p4template_quality.description: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material

V1p4forward_pcr_primer_target_location.description: Position of the most distal nucleotide templated by the forward primer or primer mix

V1p4pcr_target_locus.description: Designation of the target locus. Note that this field uses a controlled vocubulary that is meant to provide a generic classification of the locus, not necessarily the correct designation according to a specific nomenclature.

V1p4reverse_pcr_primer_target_location.description: Position of the most proximal nucleotide templated by the reverse primer or primer mix

V1p4antigen.description: The substance against which the receptor was tested. This can be any substance that stimulates an adaptive immune response in the host, either through antibody production or by T cell activation after presentation via an MHC molecule.

V1p4antigen_source_species.description: The species from which the antigen was isolated

V1p4antigen_type.description: The type of antigen before processing by the immune system.

V1p4ligand_type.description: Classification of ligand binding to the cell

V1p4mhc_allele_1.description: Allele designation of the MHC alpha chain

V1p4mhc_allele_2.description: Allele designation of the MHC class II beta chain or the invariant beta2-microglobin chain

V1p4mhc_gene_1.description: The MHC gene to which the mhc_allele_1 belongs

V1p4mhc_gene_2.description: The MHC gene to which the mhc_allele_2 belongs

V1p4peptide_end.description: End position of the peptide within the reference protein sequence

V1p4peptide_sequence_aa.description: The actual peptide sequence against which the receptor reactivity was measured. This field should be used as a convenience for antigens of antigen_type `protein` or `peptide`.

V1p4peptide_start.description: Start position of the peptide within the reference protein sequence

V1p4reactivity_method.description: The methodology used to assess/classify reactivity. This should be either the assay utlizied in the experiment, delineated as "annotated" if annotated from an external source (e.g. IEDB), or inferred if imputed using a computational method. In future versions we anticipate this field being an enumerated type, and it is strongly recommended that users utilize one of the following keywords in this field if appropriate: native_protein, MHC_peptide_multimer, annotated, inferred.

V1p4reactivity_readout.description: Reactivity measurement read-out. For physical assays, this should describe what was measured. For inferred and annotated methods this should indicate a confidence/quality level for the inference/annotation. In future versions we anticipate this field being an enumerated type, and it is strongly recommended that users utilize one of the following keywords in this field if appropriate: fluorescence_intensity, barcode_count, confidence.

V1p4reactivity_value.description: The absolute (processed) value of the measurement

V1p4deposited_version.description: Version number of the sequence within the repository

V1p4derivation.description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material

V1p4observation_type.description: The type of observation from which this sequence was drawn, such as direct sequencing or  inference from repertoire sequencing data.

V1p4repository_ref.description: Queryable id or accession number of the sequence published by the repository

V1p4c_alignment_end.description: End position of the C gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p4c_alignment_start.description: Start position of the C gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p4c_call.description: Constant region gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHG1*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB).

V1p4c_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the C gene alignment.

V1p4c_germline_alignment.description: Aligned constant region germline sequence spanning the same region as the c_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p4c_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the c_germline_aligment field.

V1p4c_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the C gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4c_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the C gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4c_identity.description: Fractional identity for the C gene alignment.

V1p4c_score.description: Alignment score for the C gene alignment.

V1p4c_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the constant region, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p4c_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the c_sequence_alignment field.

V1p4c_sequence_end.description: End position of the C gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4c_sequence_start.description: Start position of the C gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4c_support.description: C gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the C gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p4cdr1.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned CDR1 region.

V1p4cdr1_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the cdr1 field.

V1p4cdr2.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned CDR2 region.

V1p4cdr2_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the cdr2 field.

V1p4cdr3.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned CDR3 region.

V1p4cdr3_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the cdr3 field.

V1p4cdr3_end.description: CDR3 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4complete_vdj.description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment.

V1p4consensus_count.description: Number of reads contributing to the UMI consensus or contig assembly for this sequence. For example, the sum of the number of reads for all UMIs that contribute to the query sequence.

V1p4d2_alignment_end.description: End position of the second D gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d2_alignment_start.description: Start position of the second D gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d2_call.description: Second D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB).

V1p4d2_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the second D gene alignment.

V1p4d2_frame.description: Numerical reading frame (1, 2, 3) of the second D gene in the query nucleotide sequence, where frame 1 is relative to the first codon of D gene reference sequence.

V1p4d2_germline_alignment.description: Aligned D gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the d2_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p4d2_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the d2_germline_alignment field.

V1p4d2_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the second D gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d2_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the second D gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d2_identity.description: Fractional identity for the second D gene alignment.

V1p4d2_score.description: Alignment score for the second D gene alignment.

V1p4d2_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the second D gene, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p4d2_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the d2_sequence_alignment field.

V1p4d2_sequence_end.description: End position of the second D gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d2_sequence_start.description: Start position of the second D gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d2_support.description: D gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the second D gene as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p4d_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p4d_frame.description: Numerical reading frame (1, 2, 3) of the first or only D gene in the query nucleotide sequence, where frame 1 is relative to the first codon of D gene reference sequence.

V1p4d_germline_alignment.description: Aligned D gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the d_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p4d_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the d_germline_alignment field.

V1p4d_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the D gene reference sequence for the first or only D gene (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the D gene reference sequence for the first or only D gene (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d_identity.description: Fractional identity for the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p4d_score.description: Alignment score for the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p4d_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the first or only D gene, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p4d_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the d_sequence_alignment field.

V1p4d_sequence_end.description: End position of the first or only D gene in the query sequence. (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d_sequence_start.description: Start position of the first or only D gene in the query sequence. (1-based closed interval).

V1p4d_support.description: D gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the first or only D gene as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p4duplicate_count.description: Copy number or number of duplicate observations for the query sequence. For example, the number of identical reads observed for this sequence.

V1p4fwr1.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR1 region.

V1p4fwr1_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the fwr1 field.

V1p4fwr2.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR2 region.

V1p4fwr2_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the fwr2 field.

V1p4fwr3.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR3 region.

V1p4fwr3_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the fwr3 field.

V1p4fwr4.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR4 region.

V1p4fwr4_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the fwr4 field.

V1p4fwr4_end.description: FWR4 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4fwr4_start.description: FWR4 start position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4j_alignment_end.description: End position of the J gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p4j_alignment_start.description: Start position of the J gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p4j_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the J gene alignment.

V1p4j_frameshift.description: True if the J gene in the query nucleotide sequence contains a translational frameshift relative to the frame of the J gene reference sequence.

V1p4j_germline_alignment.description: Aligned J gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the j_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p4j_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the j_germline_alignment field.

V1p4j_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the J gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4j_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the J gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4j_identity.description: Fractional identity for the J gene alignment.

V1p4j_score.description: Alignment score for the J gene alignment.

V1p4j_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the J gene, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p4j_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the j_sequence_alignment field.

V1p4j_sequence_end.description: End position of the J gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4j_sequence_start.description: Start position of the J gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4j_support.description: J gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the J gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p4junction_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the junction.

V1p4locus_species.description: Binomial designation of the species from which the locus originates. Typically, this value should be identical to `organism`, if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `organism` information for all lower layers of the schema.

V1p4n1_length.description: Number of untemplated nucleotides 5' of the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p4n2_length.description: Number of untemplated nucleotides 3' of the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p4n3_length.description: Number of untemplated nucleotides 3' of the second D gene alignment.

V1p4np1.description: Nucleotide sequence of the combined N/P region between the V gene and first D gene alignment or between the V gene and J gene alignments.

V1p4np1_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the np1 field.

V1p4np1_length.description: Number of nucleotides between the V gene and first D gene alignments or between the V gene and J gene alignments.

V1p4np2.description: Nucleotide sequence of the combined N/P region between either the first D gene and J gene alignments or the first D gene and second D gene alignments.

V1p4np2_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the np2 field.

V1p4np2_length.description: Number of nucleotides between either the first D gene and J gene alignments or the first D gene and second D gene alignments.

V1p4np3.description: Nucleotide sequence of the combined N/P region between the second D gene and J gene alignments.

V1p4np3_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the np3 field.

V1p4np3_length.description: Number of nucleotides between the second D gene and J gene alignments.

V1p4p3d2_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 3' of the second D gene alignment.

V1p4p3d_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 3' of the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p4p3v_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 3' of the V gene alignment.

V1p4p5d2_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 5' of the second D gene alignment.

V1p4p5d_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 5' of the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p4p5j_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 5' of the J gene alignment.

V1p4productive.description: True if the V(D)J sequence is predicted to be productive.

V1p4quality.description: The Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.)

V1p4quality_alignment.description: Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence_alignment quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.)

V1p4sequence_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the query nucleotide sequence.

V1p4sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the aligned query sequence.

V1p4stop_codon.description: True if the aligned sequence contains a stop codon.

V1p4v_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the V gene alignment.

V1p4v_frameshift.description: True if the V gene in the query nucleotide sequence contains a translational frameshift relative to the frame of the V gene reference sequence.

V1p4v_germline_alignment.description: Aligned V gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the v_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p4v_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the v_germline_alignment field.

V1p4v_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the V gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4v_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the V gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4v_identity.description: Fractional identity for the V gene alignment.

V1p4v_score.description: Alignment score for the V gene.

V1p4v_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the V gene, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p4v_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the v_sequence_alignment field.

V1p4v_sequence_end.description: End position of the V gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4v_sequence_start.description: Start position of the V gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p4v_support.description: V gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the V gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p4vj_in_frame.description: True if the V and J gene alignments are in-frame.

V1p4receptor_hash.description: The SHA256 hash of the receptor amino acid sequence, calculated on the concatenated ``receptor_variable_domain_*_aa`` sequences and represented as base16-encoded string.

V1p4receptor_id.description: Identifier for the Receptor object. This identifier must be unique within  a given study, but it is recommended that it be a universally unique record locator to enable database applications.

V1p4receptor_ref.description: Array of receptor identifiers defined for the Receptor object

V1p4receptor_type.description: The top-level receptor type, either Immunoglobulin (Ig) or T Cell Receptor (TCR).

V1p4receptor_variable_domain_1_aa.description: Complete amino acid sequence of the mature variable domain of the Ig heavy, TCR beta or TCR delta chain. The mature variable domain is defined as encompassing all AA from and including first AA after the the signal peptide to and including the last AA that is completely encoded by the J gene.

V1p4receptor_variable_domain_1_locus.description: Locus from which the variable domain in receptor_variable_domain_1_aa originates

V1p4receptor_variable_domain_2_aa.description: Complete amino acid sequence of the mature variable domain of the Ig light, TCR alpha or TCR gamma chain. The mature variable domain is defined as encompassing all AA from and including first AA after the the signal peptide to and including the last AA that is completely encoded by the J gene.

V1p4receptor_variable_domain_2_locus.description: Locus from which the variable domain in receptor_variable_domain_2_aa originates

V1p4repertoire_name.description: Short generic display name for the repertoire

V1p4repertoire_group_name.description: Short display name for this repertoire group

V1p4repertoires.description: List of repertoires in this group with an associated description and time point designation

V1p4anatomic_site.description: The anatomic location of the tissue, e.g. Inguinal, femur

V1p4biomaterial_provider.description: Name and address of the entity providing the sample

V1p4collection_location.description: Location where the sample was taken, preferred granularity is country-level

V1p4collection_time_point_relative.description: Time point at which sample was taken, relative to `label` event

V1p4sample_id.description: Sample ID assigned by submitter, unique within study. If possible, a persistent sample ID linked to INSDC or similar repository study should be used.

V1p4sample_type.description: The way the sample was obtained, e.g. fine-needle aspirate, organ harvest, peripheral venous puncture

V1p4tissue.description: The actual tissue sampled, e.g. lymph node, liver, peripheral blood

V1p4anatomic_site.description: The anatomic location of the tissue, e.g. Inguinal, femur

V1p4biomaterial_provider.description: Name and address of the entity providing the sample

V1p4cell_isolation.description: Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells

V1p4cell_label.description: Free text cell type annotation. Primarily used for annotating cell types that are not  provided in the Cell Ontology.

V1p4cell_number.description: Total number of cells that went into the experiment

V1p4cell_phenotype.description: List of cellular markers and their expression levels used to isolate the cell population.

V1p4cell_processing_protocol.description: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript.

V1p4cell_quality.description: Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing

V1p4cell_species.description: Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to `species`, in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema.

V1p4cell_storage.description: TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing

V1p4cells_per_reaction.description: Number of cells for each biological replicate

V1p4collection_location.description: Location where the sample was taken, preferred granularity is country-level

V1p4collection_time_point_relative.description: Time point at which sample was taken, relative to `label` event

V1p4complete_sequences.description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value.

V1p4library_generation_kit_version.description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number

V1p4library_generation_protocol.description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing

V1p4pcr_target.description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead.

V1p4physical_linkage.description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv).

V1p4sample_id.description: Sample ID assigned by submitter, unique within study. If possible, a persistent sample ID linked to INSDC or similar repository study should be used.

V1p4sample_type.description: The way the sample was obtained, e.g. fine-needle aspirate, organ harvest, peripheral venous puncture

V1p4sequencing_facility.description: Name and address of sequencing facility

V1p4sequencing_files.description: Set of sequencing files produced by the sequencing run

V1p4sequencing_kit.description: Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit

V1p4sequencing_run_id.description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility

V1p4single_cell.description: TRUE if single cells were isolated into separate compartments

V1p4template_amount.description: Amount of template that went into the process

V1p4template_class.description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures

V1p4template_quality.description: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material

V1p4tissue.description: The actual tissue sampled, e.g. lymph node, liver, peripheral blood

V1p4tissue_processing.description: Enzymatic digestion and/or physical methods used to isolate cells from sample

V1p4total_reads_passing_qc_filter.description: Number of usable reads for analysis

V1p4aligned_sequence.description: Aligned sequence if this delineation provides an alignment. An aligned sequence should always be  provided for IMGT delineations.

V1p4alignment_labels.description: One string for each codon in the aligned_sequence indicating the label of that codon according to  the numbering of the delineation scheme if it provides one.

V1p4sequence_delineation_id.description: Unique identifier of this SequenceDelineationV within the file. Typically, generated by the  repository hosting the record.

V1p4unaligned_sequence.description: entire V-sequence covered by this delineation

V1p4file_type.description: File format for the raw reads or sequences

V1p4filename.description: File name for the raw reads or sequences. The first file in paired-read sequencing.

V1p4index_filename.description: File name for the index file

V1p4index_length.description: Read length in bases for the index file

V1p4paired_filename.description: File name for the second file in paired-read sequencing

V1p4paired_read_direction.description: Read direction for the second file in paired-read sequencing

V1p4paired_read_length.description: Read length in bases for the second file in paired-read sequencing

V1p4read_direction.description: Read direction for the raw reads or sequences. The first file in paired-read sequencing.

V1p4read_length.description: Read length in bases for the first file in paired-read sequencing

V1p4sequencing_data_id.description: Persistent identifier of raw data stored in an archive (e.g. INSDC run ID). Data archive should  be identified in the CURIE prefix.

V1p4sequencing_facility.description: Name and address of sequencing facility

V1p4sequencing_files.description: Set of sequencing files produced by the sequencing run

V1p4sequencing_kit.description: Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit

V1p4sequencing_run_id.description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility

V1p4total_reads_passing_qc_filter.description: Number of usable reads for analysis

V1p4adc_publish_date.description: Date the study was first published in the AIRR Data Commons.

V1p4adc_update_date.description: Date the study data was updated in the AIRR Data Commons.

V1p4contributors.description: List of individuals who contributed to the study. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The coresponding author should be listed last.

V1p4inclusion_exclusion_criteria.description: List of criteria for inclusion/exclusion for the study

V1p4keywords_study.description: Keywords describing properties of one or more data sets in a study. "contains_schema" keywords indicate that the study contains data objects from the AIRR Schema of that type (Rearrangement, Clone, Cell, Receptor) while the other keywords indicate that the study design considers the type of data indicated (e.g. it is possible to have a study that "contains_paired_chain" but does not "contains_schema_cell").

V1p4study_id.description: Unique ID assigned by study registry such as one of the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) repositories.

V1p4age.description: Age of subject expressed as a time interval. If singular time point then min == max in the time interval.

V1p4age_event.description: Event in the study schedule to which `Age` refers. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be `sampling`. For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between `Age event` and `Sample collection time`, hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity.

V1p4ethnicity.description: Ethnic group of subject (defined as cultural/language-based membership)

V1p4link_type.description: Relation between subject and `linked_subjects`, can be genetic or environmental (e.g.exposure)

V1p4linked_subjects.description: Subject ID to which `Relation type` refers

V1p4location_birth.description: Self-reported location of birth of the subject, preferred granularity is country-level

V1p4race.description: Racial group of subject (as defined by NIH)

V1p4strain_name.description: Non-human designation of the strain or breed of animal used

V1p4subject_id.description: Subject ID assigned by submitter, unique within study. If possible, a persistent subject ID linked to an INSDC or similar repository study should be used.

V1p4synthetic.description: TRUE for libraries in which the diversity has been synthetically generated (e.g. phage display)

V1p4mhc_genotype_set.description: MHC genotype set for this subject.

V1p4receptor_genotype_set.description: Immune receptor genotype set for this subject.

V1p4max.description: Upper/maximum value of the time interval

V1p4min.description: Lower/minimum value of the time interval

V1p4newick.description: Newick string of the tree edges.

V1p4nodes.description: Dictionary of nodes in the tree, keyed by sequence_id string

V1p4allele_name.description: Allele name as allocated by the inference pipeline

V1p4phasing.description: Chromosomal phasing indicator. Alleles with the same value are inferred to be located on the  same chromosome.

V1p4gff_end.description: Genomic co-ordinates of the end of the sequence of interest described in this record in  Ensemble GFF version 3.

V1p4gff_seqid.description: Sequence (from the assembly) of a window including the gene and preferably also the promoter region.

V1p4gff_start.description: Genomic co-ordinates of the start of the sequence of interest described in this record in  Ensemble GFF version 3.

V1p4patch_no.description: Genome assembly patch number in which this gene was determined

V1p4repository_ref.description: Queryable id or accession number of the sequence published by the repository

V1p5acknowledgement_id.description: unique identifier of this Acknowledgement within the file

V1p5germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5segment.description: The segment for this alignment. One of V, D, J or C.

V1p5support.description: Alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p5allele_description_id.description: Unique identifier of this AlleleDescription within the file. Typically, generated by the  repository hosting the record.

V1p5allele_description_ref.description: Unique reference to the allele description, in standardized form (Repo:Label:Version)

V1p5allele_similarity_cluster_designatio.description: ID of the similarity cluster used in this germline set, if designated

V1p5allele_similarity_cluster_member_id.description: Membership ID of the allele within the similarity cluster, if a cluster is designated

V1p5chromosome.description: chromosome on which the gene is located

V1p5coding_sequence.description: Nucleotide sequence of the core coding region, such as the coding region of a D-, J- or C- gene  or the coding region of a V-gene excluding the leader.

V1p5curational_tags.description: Controlled-vocabulary tags applied to this description

V1p5d_rs_3_prime_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 3 prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

V1p5d_rs_3_prime_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 3 prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

V1p5d_rs_5_prime_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of 5 the prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

V1p5d_rs_5_prime_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 5 prime D recombination site (D-genes only).

V1p5functional.description: True if the gene is functional, false if it is a pseudogene

V1p5gene_designation.description: Gene number or other identifier, as (and if) defined

V1p5gene_end.description: Co-ordinate in the sequence field of the last gene-coding nucleotide in the coding_sequence field.

V1p5gene_start.description: Co-ordinate in the sequence field of the first nucleotide in the coding_sequence field.

V1p5inference_type.description: Type of inference(s) from which this gene sequence was inferred

V1p5j_cdr3_end.description: In the case of a J-gene, the co-ordinate in the sequence field of the first nucelotide of the  conserved PHE or TRP (IMGT codon position 118).

V1p5j_codon_frame.description: Codon position of the first nucleotide in the 'coding_sequence' field. Mandatory for J genes.  Not used for V or D genes. '1' means the sequence is in-frame, '2' means that the first bp is  missing from the first codon, and '3' means that the first 2 bp are missing.

V1p5j_donor_splice.description: Co-ordinate in the sequence field of the final 3' nucleotide of the J-REGION (J-genes only).

V1p5j_rs_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of J recombination site (J-genes only).

V1p5j_rs_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of J recombination site (J-genes only).

V1p5leader_1_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART1 (V-genes only).

V1p5leader_1_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART1 (V-genes only).

V1p5leader_2_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART2 (V-genes only).

V1p5leader_2_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of L-PART2 (V-genes only).

V1p5release_description.description: Brief descriptive notes of the reason for this release and the changes embodied

V1p5species_subgroup.description: Race, strain or other species subgroup to which this subject belongs

V1p5status.description: Status of record, assumed active if the field is not present

V1p5subgroup_designation.description: Identifier of the gene subgroup or clade, as (and if) defined

V1p5utr_5_prime_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 5 prime UTR (V-genes only).

V1p5utr_5_prime_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the 5 prime UTR (V-genes only).

V1p5v_rs_end.description: End co-ordinate in the sequence field of the V recombination site (V-genes only).

V1p5v_rs_start.description: Start co-ordinate in the sequence field of the V recombination site (V-genes only).

V1p5expression_index.description: Index addressing the current event within the raw data set.

V1p5expression_raw_doi.description: DOI of raw data set containing the current event

V1p5expression_study_method.description: Keyword describing the methodology used to assess expression. This values for this field MUST  come from a controlled vocabulary.

V1p5rearrangements.description: Array of sequence identifiers defined for the Rearrangement object

V1p5receptors.description: Array of receptor identifiers defined for the Receptor object

V1p5virtual_pairing.description: boolean to indicate if pairing was inferred.

V1p5expression_id.description: Identifier of this expression property measurement.

V1p5property.description: Name of the property observed, typically a gene or antibody identifier (and label) from a  canonical resource such as Ensembl (e.g. ENSG00000275747, IGHV3-79) or  Antibody Registry (ABREG:1236456, Purified anti-mouse/rat/human CD27 antibody).

V1p5property_type.description: Keyword describing the property type and detection method used to measure the property value. The following keywords are recommended, but custom property types are also valid: "mrna_expression_by_read_count", "protein_expression_by_fluorescence_intensity", "antigen_bait_binding_by_fluorescence_intensity", "protein_expression_by_dna_barcode_count" and "antigen_bait_binding_by_dna_barcode_count".

V1p5property_value.description: Level at which the property was observed in the experiment (non-normalized).

V1p5cell_isolation.description: Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells

V1p5cell_number.description: Total number of cells that went into the experiment

V1p5cell_phenotype.description: List of cellular markers and their expression levels used to isolate the cell population

V1p5cell_processing_protocol.description: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript.

V1p5cell_quality.description: Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing

V1p5cell_species.description: Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to `species`, in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema.

V1p5cell_storage.description: TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing

V1p5cell_subset.description: Commonly-used designation of isolated cell population

V1p5cells_per_reaction.description: Number of cells for each biological replicate

V1p5single_cell.description: TRUE if single cells were isolated into separate compartments

V1p5tissue_processing.description: Enzymatic digestion and/or physical methods used to isolate cells from sample

V1p5clone_count.description: Absolute count of the size (number of members) of this clone in the repertoire. This could simply be the number of sequences (Rearrangement records) observed in this clone, the number of distinct cell barcodes (unique cell_id values), or a more sophisticated calculation appropriate to the experimental protocol. Absolute count is provided versus a frequency so that downstream analysis tools can perform their own normalization.

V1p5j_alignment_end.description: End position of the J gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p5j_alignment_start.description: Start position of the J gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p5junction_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the junction.

V1p5junction_end.description: Junction region end position in the alignment (1-based closed interval).

V1p5junction_start.description: Junction region start position in the alignment (1-based closed interval).

V1p5seed_id.description: sequence_id of the seed sequence. Empty string (or null) if there is no seed sequence.

V1p5sequences.description: List sequence_id strings that act as keys to the Rearrangement records for members of the clone.

V1p5analysis_provenance_id.description: Identifier for machine-readable PROV model of analysis provenance

V1p5collapsing_method.description: The method used for combining multiple sequences from (4) into a single sequence in (5)

V1p5data_processing_files.description: Array of file names for data produced by this data processing.

V1p5data_processing_protocols.description: General description of how QC is performed

V1p5germline_database.description: Source of germline V(D)J genes with version number or date accessed.

V1p5paired_reads_assembly.description: How paired end reads were assembled into a single receptor sequence

V1p5primary_annotation.description: If true, indicates this is the primary or default data processing for the repertoire and its rearrangements. If false, indicates this is a secondary or additional data processing.

V1p5primer_match_cutoffs.description: How primers were identified in the sequences, were they removed/masked/etc?

V1p5quality_thresholds.description: How/if sequences were removed from (4) based on base quality scores

V1p5software_versions.description: Version number and / or date, include company pipelines

V1p5phasing.description: Chromosomal phasing indicator. Alleles with the same value are inferred to be located on the  same chromosome.

V1p5disease_length.description: Time duration between initial diagnosis and current intervention

V1p5disease_stage.description: Stage of disease at current intervention

V1p5immunogen.description: Antigen, vaccine or drug applied to subject at this intervention

V1p5medical_history.description: Medical history of subject that is relevant to assess the course of disease and/or treatment

V1p5prior_therapies.description: List of all relevant previous therapies applied to subject for treatment of `Diagnosis`

V1p5study_group_description.description: Designation of study arm to which the subject is assigned to

V1p5phasing.description: Chromosomal phasing indicator. Alleles with the same value are inferred to be located on the  same chromosome.

V1p5deleted_genes.description: Array of genes identified as being deleted in this genotype

V1p5documented_alleles.description: List of alleles documented in reference set(s)

V1p5inference_process.description: Information on how the genotype was acquired. Controlled vocabulary.

V1p5receptor_genotype_id.description: A unique identifier within the file for this Receptor Genotype, typically generated by the  repository hosting the schema, for example from the underlying ID of the database record.

V1p5undocumented_alleles.description: List of alleles inferred to be present and not documented in an identified GermlineSet

V1p5genotype_class_list.description: List of Genotypes included in this Receptor Genotype Set.

V1p5receptor_genotype_set_id.description: A unique identifier for this Receptor Genotype Set, typically generated by the repository  hosting the schema, for example from the underlying ID of the database record.

V1p5allele_descriptions.description: list of allele_descriptions in the germline set

V1p5germline_set_id.description: Unique identifier of the GermlineSet within this file. Typically, generated by the  repository hosting the record.

V1p5germline_set_name.description: descriptive name of this germline set

V1p5release_description.description: Brief descriptive notes of the reason for this release and the changes embodied

V1p5species_subgroup.description: Race, strain or other species subgroup to which this subject belongs

V1p5gene.description: The MHC gene to which the described allele belongs

V1p5reference_set_ref.description: Repository and list from which it was taken (issuer/name/version)

V1p5mhc_alleles.description: List of MHC alleles of the indicated mhc_class identified in an individual

V1p5mhc_genotype_id.description: A unique identifier for this MHCGenotype, assumed to be unique in the context of the study

V1p5mhc_genotyping_method.description: Information on how the genotype was determined. The content of this field should come from a list of recommended terms provided in the AIRR Schema documentation.

V1p5mhc_genotype_list.description: List of MHCGenotypes included in this set

V1p5mhc_genotype_set_id.description: A unique identifier for this MHCGenotypeSet

V1p5junction_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the junction.

V1p5complete_sequences.description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value.

V1p5library_generation_kit_version.description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number

V1p5library_generation_protocol.description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing

V1p5pcr_target.description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead.

V1p5physical_linkage.description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv).

V1p5template_amount.description: Amount of template that went into the process

V1p5template_class.description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures
