V1p5template_quality.description: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material

V1p5forward_pcr_primer_target_location.description: Position of the most distal nucleotide templated by the forward primer or primer mix

V1p5pcr_target_locus.description: Designation of the target locus. Note that this field uses a controlled vocubulary that is meant to provide a generic classification of the locus, not necessarily the correct designation according to a specific nomenclature.

V1p5reverse_pcr_primer_target_location.description: Position of the most proximal nucleotide templated by the reverse primer or primer mix

V1p5deposited_version.description: Version number of the sequence within the repository

V1p5derivation.description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material

V1p5observation_type.description: The type of observation from which this sequence was drawn, such as direct sequencing or  inference from repertoire sequencing data.

V1p5repository_ref.description: Queryable id or accession number of the sequence published by the repository

V1p5c_alignment_end.description: End position of the C gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p5c_alignment_start.description: Start position of the C gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p5c_call.description: Constant region gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHG1*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB).

V1p5c_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the C gene alignment.

V1p5c_germline_alignment.description: Aligned constant region germline sequence spanning the same region as the c_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p5c_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the c_germline_aligment field.

V1p5c_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the C gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5c_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the C gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5c_identity.description: Fractional identity for the C gene alignment.

V1p5c_score.description: Alignment score for the C gene alignment.

V1p5c_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the constant region, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p5c_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the c_sequence_alignment field.

V1p5c_sequence_end.description: End position of the C gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5c_sequence_start.description: Start position of the C gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5c_support.description: C gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the C gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p5cdr1.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned CDR1 region.

V1p5cdr1_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the cdr1 field.

V1p5cdr2.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned CDR2 region.

V1p5cdr2_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the cdr2 field.

V1p5cdr3.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned CDR3 region.

V1p5cdr3_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the cdr3 field.

V1p5cdr3_end.description: CDR3 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5complete_vdj.description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment.

V1p5consensus_count.description: Number of reads contributing to the UMI consensus or contig assembly for this sequence. For example, the sum of the number of reads for all UMIs that contribute to the query sequence.

V1p5d2_alignment_end.description: End position of the second D gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d2_alignment_start.description: Start position of the second D gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d2_call.description: Second D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB).

V1p5d2_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the second D gene alignment.

V1p5d2_frame.description: Numerical reading frame (1, 2, 3) of the second D gene in the query nucleotide sequence, where frame 1 is relative to the first codon of D gene reference sequence.

V1p5d2_germline_alignment.description: Aligned D gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the d2_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p5d2_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the d2_germline_alignment field.

V1p5d2_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the second D gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d2_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the second D gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d2_identity.description: Fractional identity for the second D gene alignment.

V1p5d2_score.description: Alignment score for the second D gene alignment.

V1p5d2_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the second D gene, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p5d2_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the d2_sequence_alignment field.

V1p5d2_sequence_end.description: End position of the second D gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d2_sequence_start.description: Start position of the second D gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d2_support.description: D gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the second D gene as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p5d_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p5d_frame.description: Numerical reading frame (1, 2, 3) of the first or only D gene in the query nucleotide sequence, where frame 1 is relative to the first codon of D gene reference sequence.

V1p5d_germline_alignment.description: Aligned D gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the d_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p5d_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the d_germline_alignment field.

V1p5d_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the D gene reference sequence for the first or only D gene (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the D gene reference sequence for the first or only D gene (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d_identity.description: Fractional identity for the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p5d_score.description: Alignment score for the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p5d_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the first or only D gene, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p5d_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the d_sequence_alignment field.

V1p5d_sequence_end.description: End position of the first or only D gene in the query sequence. (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d_sequence_start.description: Start position of the first or only D gene in the query sequence. (1-based closed interval).

V1p5d_support.description: D gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the first or only D gene as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p5duplicate_count.description: Copy number or number of duplicate observations for the query sequence. For example, the number of identical reads observed for this sequence.

V1p5fwr1.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR1 region.

V1p5fwr1_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the fwr1 field.

V1p5fwr2.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR2 region.

V1p5fwr2_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the fwr2 field.

V1p5fwr3.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR3 region.

V1p5fwr3_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the fwr3 field.

V1p5fwr4.description: Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR4 region.

V1p5fwr4_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the fwr4 field.

V1p5fwr4_end.description: FWR4 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5fwr4_start.description: FWR4 start position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5j_alignment_end.description: End position of the J gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p5j_alignment_start.description: Start position of the J gene alignment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).

V1p5j_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the J gene alignment.

V1p5j_frameshift.description: True if the J gene in the query nucleotide sequence contains a translational frameshift relative to the frame of the J gene reference sequence.

V1p5j_germline_alignment.description: Aligned J gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the j_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p5j_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the j_germline_alignment field.

V1p5j_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the J gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5j_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the J gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5j_identity.description: Fractional identity for the J gene alignment.

V1p5j_score.description: Alignment score for the J gene alignment.

V1p5j_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the J gene, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p5j_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the j_sequence_alignment field.

V1p5j_sequence_end.description: End position of the J gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5j_sequence_start.description: Start position of the J gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5j_support.description: J gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the J gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p5junction_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the junction.

V1p5n1_length.description: Number of untemplated nucleotides 5' of the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p5n2_length.description: Number of untemplated nucleotides 3' of the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p5n3_length.description: Number of untemplated nucleotides 3' of the second D gene alignment.

V1p5np1.description: Nucleotide sequence of the combined N/P region between the V gene and first D gene alignment or between the V gene and J gene alignments.

V1p5np1_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the np1 field.

V1p5np1_length.description: Number of nucleotides between the V gene and first D gene alignments or between the V gene and J gene alignments.

V1p5np2.description: Nucleotide sequence of the combined N/P region between either the first D gene and J gene alignments or the first D gene and second D gene alignments.

V1p5np2_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the np2 field.

V1p5np2_length.description: Number of nucleotides between either the first D gene and J gene alignments or the first D gene and second D gene alignments.

V1p5np3.description: Nucleotide sequence of the combined N/P region between the second D gene and J gene alignments.

V1p5np3_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the np3 field.

V1p5np3_length.description: Number of nucleotides between the second D gene and J gene alignments.

V1p5p3d2_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 3' of the second D gene alignment.

V1p5p3d_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 3' of the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p5p3v_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 3' of the V gene alignment.

V1p5p5d2_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 5' of the second D gene alignment.

V1p5p5d_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 5' of the first or only D gene alignment.

V1p5p5j_length.description: Number of palindromic nucleotides 5' of the J gene alignment.

V1p5productive.description: True if the V(D)J sequence is predicted to be productive.

V1p5quality.description: The Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.)

V1p5quality_alignment.description: Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence_alignment quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.)

V1p5sequence_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the query nucleotide sequence.

V1p5sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the aligned query sequence.

V1p5stop_codon.description: True if the aligned sequence contains a stop codon.

V1p5v_cigar.description: CIGAR string for the V gene alignment.

V1p5v_frameshift.description: True if the V gene in the query nucleotide sequence contains a translational frameshift relative to the frame of the V gene reference sequence.

V1p5v_germline_alignment.description: Aligned V gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the v_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).

V1p5v_germline_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the v_germline_alignment field.

V1p5v_germline_end.description: Alignment end position in the V gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5v_germline_start.description: Alignment start position in the V gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5v_identity.description: Fractional identity for the V gene alignment.

V1p5v_score.description: Alignment score for the V gene.

V1p5v_sequence_alignment.description: Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the V gene, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.

V1p5v_sequence_alignment_aa.description: Amino acid translation of the v_sequence_alignment field.

V1p5v_sequence_end.description: End position of the V gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5v_sequence_start.description: Start position of the V gene in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).

V1p5v_support.description: V gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the V gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.

V1p5vj_in_frame.description: True if the V and J gene alignments are in-frame.

V1p5receptor_hash.description: The SHA256 hash of the receptor amino acid sequence, calculated on the concatenated ``receptor_variable_domain_*_aa`` sequences and represented as base16-encoded string.

V1p5receptor_id.description: ID of the current Receptor object, unique within the local repository.

V1p5receptor_ref.description: Array of receptor identifiers defined for the Receptor object

V1p5receptor_type.description: The top-level receptor type, either Immunoglobulin (Ig) or T Cell Receptor (TCR).

V1p5receptor_variable_domain_1_aa.description: Complete amino acid sequence of the mature variable domain of the Ig heavy, TCR beta or TCR delta chain. The mature variable domain is defined as encompassing all AA from and including first AA after the the signal peptide to and including the last AA that is completely encoded by the J gene.

V1p5receptor_variable_domain_1_locus.description: Locus from which the variable domain in receptor_variable_domain_1_aa originates

V1p5receptor_variable_domain_2_aa.description: Complete amino acid sequence of the mature variable domain of the Ig light, TCR alpha or TCR gamma chain. The mature variable domain is defined as encompassing all AA from and including first AA after the the signal peptide to and including the last AA that is completely encoded by the J gene.

V1p5receptor_variable_domain_2_locus.description: Locus from which the variable domain in receptor_variable_domain_2_aa originates

V1p5antigen.description: The substance against which the receptor was tested. This can be any substance that stimulates an adaptive immune response in the host, either through antibody production or by T cell activation after presentation via an MHC molecule.

V1p5antigen_source_species.description: The species from which the antigen was isolated

V1p5antigen_type.description: The type of antigen before processing by the immune system.

V1p5ligand_type.description: Classification of ligand binding to receptor

V1p5mhc_allele_1.description: Allele designation of the MHC alpha chain

V1p5mhc_allele_2.description: Allele designation of the MHC class II beta chain or the invariant beta2-microglobin chain

V1p5mhc_gene_1.description: The MHC gene to which the mhc_allele_1 belongs

V1p5mhc_gene_2.description: The MHC gene to which the mhc_allele_2 belongs

V1p5peptide_end.description: End position of the peptide within the reference protein sequence

V1p5peptide_start.description: Start position of the peptide within the reference protein sequence

V1p5reactivity_method.description: The methodology used to assess expression (assay implemented in experiment)

V1p5reactivity_value.description: The absolute (processed) value of the measurement

V1p5repertoire_name.description: Short generic display name for the repertoire

V1p5repertoire_group_name.description: Short display name for this repertoire collection

V1p5repertoires.description: List of repertoires in this collection with an associated description and time point designation

V1p5time_point.description: Time point designation for this repertoire within the group

V1p5anatomic_site.description: The anatomic location of the tissue, e.g. Inguinal, femur

V1p5biomaterial_provider.description: Name and address of the entity providing the sample

V1p5collection_time_point_reference.description: Event in the study schedule to which `Sample collection time` relates to

V1p5collection_time_point_relative.description: Time point at which sample was taken, relative to `Collection time event`

V1p5sample_id.description: Sample ID assigned by submitter, unique within study. If possible, a persistent sample ID linked to INSDC or similar repository study should be used.

V1p5sample_type.description: The way the sample was obtained, e.g. fine-needle aspirate, organ harvest, peripheral venous puncture

V1p5tissue.description: The actual tissue sampled, e.g. lymph node, liver, peripheral blood

V1p5anatomic_site.description: The anatomic location of the tissue, e.g. Inguinal, femur

V1p5biomaterial_provider.description: Name and address of the entity providing the sample

V1p5cell_isolation.description: Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells

V1p5cell_number.description: Total number of cells that went into the experiment

V1p5cell_phenotype.description: List of cellular markers and their expression levels used to isolate the cell population

V1p5cell_processing_protocol.description: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript.

V1p5cell_quality.description: Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing

V1p5cell_species.description: Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to `species`, in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema.

V1p5cell_storage.description: TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing

V1p5cell_subset.description: Commonly-used designation of isolated cell population

V1p5cells_per_reaction.description: Number of cells for each biological replicate

V1p5collection_time_point_reference.description: Event in the study schedule to which `Sample collection time` relates to

V1p5collection_time_point_relative.description: Time point at which sample was taken, relative to `Collection time event`

It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value.

V1p5library_generation_kit_version.description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number

V1p5library_generation_protocol.description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing

V1p5pcr_target.description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead.

V1p5physical_linkage.description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv).

V1p5sample_id.description: Sample ID assigned by submitter, unique within study. If possible, a persistent sample ID linked to INSDC or similar repository study should be used.

V1p5sample_type.description: The way the sample was obtained, e.g. fine-needle aspirate, organ harvest, peripheral venous puncture

V1p5sequencing_facility.description: Name and address of sequencing facility

V1p5sequencing_files.description: Set of sequencing files produced by the sequencing run

V1p5sequencing_kit.description: Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit

V1p5sequencing_run_id.description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility

V1p5single_cell.description: TRUE if single cells were isolated into separate compartments

V1p5template_amount.description: Amount of template that went into the process

V1p5template_class.description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures

V1p5template_quality.description: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material

V1p5tissue.description: The actual tissue sampled, e.g. lymph node, liver, peripheral blood

V1p5tissue_processing.description: Enzymatic digestion and/or physical methods used to isolate cells from sample

V1p5total_reads_passing_qc_filter.description: Number of usable reads for analysis

V1p5aligned_sequence.description: Aligned sequence if this delineation provides an alignment. An aligned sequence should always be  provided for IMGT delineations.

V1p5alignment_labels.description: One string for each codon in the aligned_sequence indicating the label of that codon according to  the numbering of the delineation scheme if it provides one.

V1p5sequence_delineation_id.description: Unique identifier of this SequenceDelineationV within the file. Typically, generated by the  repository hosting the record.

V1p5unaligned_sequence.description: entire V-sequence covered by this delineation

V1p5file_type.description: File format for the raw reads or sequences

V1p5filename.description: File name for the raw reads or sequences. The first file in paired-read sequencing.

V1p5index_filename.description: File name for the index file

V1p5index_length.description: Read length in bases for the index file

V1p5paired_filename.description: File name for the second file in paired-read sequencing

V1p5paired_read_direction.description: Read direction for the second file in paired-read sequencing

V1p5paired_read_length.description: Read length in bases for the second file in paired-read sequencing

V1p5read_direction.description: Read direction for the raw reads or sequences. The first file in paired-read sequencing.

V1p5read_length.description: Read length in bases for the first file in paired-read sequencing

V1p5sequencing_data_id.description: Persistent identifier of raw data stored in an archive (e.g. INSDC run ID). Data archive should  be identified in the CURIE prefix.

V1p5sequencing_facility.description: Name and address of sequencing facility

V1p5sequencing_files.description: Set of sequencing files produced by the sequencing run

V1p5sequencing_kit.description: Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit

V1p5sequencing_run_id.description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility

V1p5total_reads_passing_qc_filter.description: Number of usable reads for analysis

V1p5adc_publish_date.description: Date the study was first published in the AIRR Data Commons.

V1p5adc_update_date.description: Date the study data was updated in the AIRR Data Commons.

V1p5collected_by.description: Full contact information of the data collector, i.e. the person who is legally responsible for data collection and release. This should include an e-mail address and a persistent identifier such as an ORCID ID.

V1p5inclusion_exclusion_criteria.description: List of criteria for inclusion/exclusion for the study

V1p5keywords_study.description: Keywords describing properties of one or more data sets in a study. "contains_schema" keywords indicate that the study contains data objects from the AIRR Schema of that type (Rearrangement, Clone, Cell, Receptor) while the other keywords indicate that the study design considers the type of data indicated (e.g. it is possible to have a study that "contains_paired_chain" but does not "contains_schema_cell").

V1p5study_contact.description: Full contact information of the contact persons for this study This should include an e-mail address and a persistent identifier such as an ORCID ID.

V1p5study_id.description: Unique ID assigned by study registry such as one of the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) repositories.

V1p5submitted_by.description: Full contact information of the data depositor, i.e., the person submitting the data to a repository. This should include an e-mail address and a persistent identifier such as an ORCID ID. This is supposed to be a short-lived and technical role until the submission is relased.

V1p5age_event.description: Event in the study schedule to which `Age` refers. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be `sampling`. For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between `Age event` and `Sample collection time`, hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity.

V1p5age_max.description: Upper boundary of age range or equal to age_min for specific age. This field should only be null if age_min is null.

V1p5age_min.description: Specific age or lower boundary of age range.

V1p5ethnicity.description: Ethnic group of subject (defined as cultural/language-based membership)

V1p5link_type.description: Relation between subject and `linked_subjects`, can be genetic or environmental (e.g.exposure)

V1p5linked_subjects.description: Subject ID to which `Relation type` refers

V1p5race.description: Racial group of subject (as defined by NIH)

V1p5strain_name.description: Non-human designation of the strain or breed of animal used

V1p5subject_id.description: Subject ID assigned by submitter, unique within study. If possible, a persistent subject ID linked to an INSDC or similar repository study should be used.

V1p5synthetic.description: TRUE for libraries in which the diversity has been synthetically generated (e.g. phage display)

V1p5mhc_genotype_set.description: MHC genotype set for this subject.

V1p5receptor_genotype_set.description: Immune receptor genotype set for this subject.

V1p5time_point_label.description: Informative label for the time point

V1p5newick.description: Newick string of the tree edges.

V1p5nodes.description: Dictionary of nodes in the tree, keyed by sequence_id string

V1p5allele_name.description: Allele name as allocated by the inference pipeline

V1p5phasing.description: Chromosomal phasing indicator. Alleles with the same value are inferred to be located on the  same chromosome.

V1p5gff_end.description: Genomic co-ordinates of the end of the sequence of interest described in this record in  Ensemble GFF version 3.

V1p5gff_seqid.description: Sequence (from the assembly) of a window including the gene and preferably also the promoter region.

V1p5gff_start.description: Genomic co-ordinates of the start of the sequence of interest described in this record in  Ensemble GFF version 3.

V1p5patch_no.description: Genome assembly patch number in which this gene was determined

V1p5repository_ref.description: Queryable id or accession number of the sequence published by the repository

description: A container for instances of multiple classes.
title: ak-schema
